Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I used to run like this...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But now I run like this which is way faster!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: And the winner is... Luchadora Coco!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I have a dimple on this side, but not on this side. Dimple. No dimple. Dimple. No dimple--

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Aw, you're a twig, mijo.         Have some more.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: I asked if you would like more tamales.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: That's what I THOUGHT you said.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Sit. Down. Roll over.        Shake. Fist bump.

Speaker: tour guide
Dialogue: And right here, in this very plaza, the young Ernesto de la Cruz took his first steps toward becoming the most beloved singer in Mexican history!
DE LA CRUZ  When he was crushed by a giant bell.  CUT TO:

Speaker: plaza mariachi
Dialogue: I asked for a shoe shine, not your life story.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I just can't really talk about any of this at home so...

Speaker: plaza mariachi
Dialogue: Look, if I were you I'd march right up to my family and say, "Hey! I'm a musician. Deal with it!"

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I don't know. I mean... I only really play for myself--

Speaker: plaza mariachi
Dialogue: Did de la Cruz become the world's best musician by hiding his sweet, sweet skills? No! He walked out onto that plaza and he played out loud!

Speaker: plaza mariachi
Dialogue: Look, if you're too scared, then, well... have fun making shoes.

Speaker: plaza mariachi
Dialogue: Show me what you got, muchacho. I'll be your first audience.

Speaker: plaza mariachi
Dialogue: Doa, please -- I was just getting a shine!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: I know your tricks, mariachi!  What did he say to you?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: He was just showing me his guitar...

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: My grandson is a sweet little angelito querido cielito -- he wants no part of your music, mariachi! You keep away from him!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: You know better than to be here in this place! You will come home. Now.

Speaker: to berto
Dialogue: How many times have we told you -- that plaza is crawling with mariachis!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Never name a street dog.         They'll follow you forever.  Now, go get my shoe.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: I found your son in Mariachi Plaza!

Speaker: mam
Dialogue: You know how Abuelita feels about the plaza.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But the plaza's where all the foot traffic is.

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: If Abuelita says no more plaza, then no more plaza.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Well they're having this talent show-

Speaker: prima rosa
Dialogue: You have to have talent to be in a talent show.

Speaker: primo abel
Dialogue: What are YOU going to do, shine shoes?

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: It's Da de los Muertos -- no one's going anywhere. Tonight is about family.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Don't give me that look. Da de los Muertos is the one night of the year our ancestors can come visit us.  We made all this food -- set out the things they loved in life, mijo. All this work to bring the family together. I don't want you sneaking off to who-knows-where.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Ay, Dios mo... Being part of this family means being HERE for this family... I don't want to see you end up like--

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Never mention that man!      He's better off forgotten.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: No Mam.   It's okay, I'm here.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Oh, it's you. Get in here, c'mon, Dante. Hurry up.  Dante wriggles into the hideout. Miguel is huddled over something. The dog peeks around his shoulder.  MIGUEL  I have to sing. I have to play. The music, it's -- it's not just in me. It is me.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No more hiding, Dante.      I gotta seize my moment!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Da de los Muertos has begun!

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: Mam, where should we put this table?

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: You want it down by the kitchen?

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: S.   Next to the other one.

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: Miguel...  We've all decided -- it's time you joined us in the workshop!

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: No more shining shoes -- you will be making them! Every day after school!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Our Migueli-ti-ti-ti-to carrying on the family tradition! And on Da de los Muertos! Your ancestors will be so proud!

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: And wingtips, like your Pap Julio--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But what if I'm no good at making shoes?

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: Ah, Migue... You have your family here to guide you...  You are a Rivera. And a Rivera is...?

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: That's my boy!  Berto, break out the good stuff, I wanna make a toast!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Mam Coco, is your pap... Ernesto de la Cruz?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Mam Coco's father was Ernesto de la Cruz!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: What is all this? You keep secrets from your own family?

Speaker: to berto
Dialogue: It's all that time he spends in the plaza...

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: We've never known anything about this man. But whoever he was, he still abandoned his family. This is no future for my son.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But Pap, you said my family would guide me! Well de la Cruz IS my family! I'm supposed to play music!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Never!    That man's music was a curse!    I will not allow it!

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: You will listen to your family.    No more music.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: You want to end up like that man? Forgotten? Left off your family's ofrenda?!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I don't care if I'm on some stupid ofrenda!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I don't wanna be in this family!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I wanna play in the plaza. Like de la Cruz! Can I still sign-up?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No... But if I can borrow a guitar--

Speaker: stage manager
Dialogue: Musicians gotta bring their own instruments...  You find a guitar, kid, I'll put you on the list.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Excuse me, can I borrow your guitar?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You guys have a spare guitar?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I need a guitar, just for a little bit--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Great-great grandfather... What am I supposed to do?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No, no, no, no, no, Dante stop! Cllate! Shhh!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Seor de la Cruz? Please don't be mad. I'm Miguel, your great-great grandson... I need to borrow this.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I... I'm sorry! It's not what it looks like! De la Cruz is my...

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Dios mo!    Little boy, are you okay?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Dante?! You can see me?          W-wait! What's going on?!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Remind me how I know you?

Speaker: pap julio
Dialogue: We need Mam Imelda. She'll know how to fix this!

Speaker: ta victoria
Dialogue: I have a feeling this has something to do with you.

Speaker: ta rosita
Dialogue: But if Mam Imelda can't come to us...

Speaker: pap julio
Dialogue: ...Then we are going to her! Vmonos!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: This isn't a dream, then.        You're all really out there...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Well I don't know, I thought it might've been one of those made up things that adults tell kids... like... vitamins.

Speaker: ta victoria
Dialogue: Miguel, vitamins are a real thing.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Well, now I'm thinking maybe they could be...

Speaker: skeleton mother
Dialogue: Mija, it's not nice to stare at--  Ay! Santa Maria!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Are those...? Alebrijes!         But those are--

Speaker: ta rosita
Dialogue: They guide souls on their journey...

Speaker: to felipe
Dialogue: Watch your step, they make caquitas everywhere.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Yes, it is I. Frida Kahlo.  Shall we skip the scanner? I'm on so many ofrendas, it'll just overwhelm your blinky thingie...

Speaker: departures agent
Dialogue: Well shoot. Looks like no one put up your photo, Frida...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Okay, when I said I was Frida... just now? That... that was a lie. And I apologize for doing that.

Speaker: departures agent
Dialogue: No photo on an ofrenda, no crossing the bridge.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You know what, I'm just gonna zip right over, you won't even know I'm gone.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Almost there, just a little further...!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Fine, okay. Fine, who cares... Dumb flower bridge!

Speaker: ta rosita
Dialogue: I don't know what I'd do if no one put up my photo.

Speaker: ta rosita
Dialogue: Oh!   Come mijo, it's our turn.

Speaker: arrivals agent
Dialogue: Welcome back, amigos! Anything to declare?

Speaker: pap julio
Dialogue: As a matter of fact, yes.

Speaker: distressed traveler
Dialogue: C'mon! Help us out amigo... We gotta get to a dozen ofrendas tonight...

Speaker: miffed wife
Dialogue: We are NOT visiting your ex-wife's family for Da de Muertos!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I demand to speak to the person in charge!

Speaker: case worker
Dialogue: I'm sorry, seora, it says here no one put up your photo--

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: My family always -- ALWAYS -- puts my photo on the ofrenda! That devil box tells you nothing but lies!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Oh, mi familia! They wouldn't let me cross the bridge! Tell this woman and her devil box that my photo is on the ofrenda.

Speaker: pap julio
Dialogue: Well, we never made it to the ofrenda...

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Da de los Muertos is a night to GIVE to the dead. You STOLE from the dead.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But I wasn't stealing the guitar!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: It was my great-great grandfather's, he would have wanted me to have it--

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Ah-ah-ah! We do not speak of that...  ...musician! He is DEAD to this family!

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: ACHOO! I am sorry, whose alebrije is that?

Speaker: ta rosita
Dialogue: He sure doesn't look like an alebrije.

Speaker: to oscar
Dialogue: He just looks like a plain old dog...

Speaker: to felipe
Dialogue: ...Or a sausage someone dropped in a barbershop.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Whatever he is, I am -- ACHOO! -- terribly allergic.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But Dante doesn't have any hair.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: And I don't have a nose, and yet here we are -- ACHOO!!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: But none of this explains why I couldn't cross over.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: You took my photo off the ofrenda?!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: How do we send him back?!

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Well, since it's a family matter...  The way to undo a family curse is to get your family's blessing.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Get your family's blessing, and everything SHOULD go back to normal. But you gotta do it by sunrise!

Speaker: pap julio
Dialogue: Whoa, Miguel. Can't have you fainting on us.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: But not to worry! Your family's here, you can get your blessing right now.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Now, you look at the living and say his name.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Nailed it.     Now say: I give you my blessing.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Well technically she can add any conditions she wants.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Then you hand the petal to Miguel.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Two seconds and you already break your promise!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: This isn't fair, it's my life!     You already had yours!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Pap Julio, I ask for your blessing.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Don't make this hard, mijo.      You go home my way, or no way.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You really hate music that much?

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I will not let you go down the same path he did.

Speaker: to oscar
Dialogue: She's just looking out for you.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Con permiso, I... need to visit the restroom. Be right back!

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Uh, should we tell him there are no restrooms in the Land of the Dead?

Speaker: patrolwoman
Dialogue: We got a family looking for a LIVING BOY.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: If I wanna be a musician, I need a MUSICIAN'S blessing. We gotta find my great-great grandpa.

Speaker: patrolman
Dialogue: Uh whoa, excuse me, excuse me folks! Excuse me--

Speaker: corrections officer
Dialogue: ...disturbing the peace, fleeing an officer, falsifying a unibrow...

Speaker: corrections officer
Dialogue: VERY illegal. You need to clean up your act, amigo.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Amigo?  I've just had a really hard Da de Muertos, and I could really use an amigo right now.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I'll -- I'll get you backstage, you can meet him!  You just gotta let me cross that bridge!

Speaker: corrections officer
Dialogue: I should lock you up for the rest of the holiday...  But my shift's almost up, and I wanna visit my living family... so I'm letting you off with a warning.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Can I at least get my costume back?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Hey. Hey!     You really know de la Cruz?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Who wants to--  Ah! You're alive!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: D'ya know what, maybe this isn't such a g--

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: No, nio, nio, nio, I can help you! You can help me. We can help each other! But most importantly, you can help ME.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Ay, he is going to get himself killed... I need my spirit guide, Pepita.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Who has that petal Miguel touched?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Hey, hey, hold still.  Look up. Look up. A ver, a ver... look up. Up, UP!... Ta-da!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You don't get to cross over.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: No one's ever put up my picture...  But you can change that!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: So you get me to my great-great grandpa, then I put up your photo when I get home?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Such a smart boy! Yes! Great idea, yes!  So, you got any other family here, you know? Someone a bit more... accessible?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Don't yank my chain, chamaco.      You gotta have SOME other family.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: ONLY de la Cruz. If you can't help me, I'll find him myself.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Okay, okay, kid, fine -- fine! I'll get you to your great-great grandpa...!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I'm walking like a skeleton. Blending in.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: No, skeletons don't walk like that.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Whoa..."Ernesto de la Cruz's Sunrise Spectacular...!" Qu padre!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Blech. Every year, your great- great grandpa puts on that dumb show to mark the end of Da de Muertos.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: And you can get us in!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Hey, you said you had front row tickets!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: That... that was a lie.      I apologize for that.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Cool off, chamaco, come on... I'll get you to him.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: 'Cause I happen to know where he's rehearsing!

Speaker: cecilia
Dialogue: You better have my dress, Hctor!

Speaker: cecilia
Dialogue: Ya lo saba! I gotta dress forty dancers by sunrise and thanks to you, I'm one Frida short of an opening number!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Ceci -- I know, Ceci. I know, I know. Ceci -- Ceci... Ceci. Ceci...

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: You!    How did you get in here?

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: Oh, the mighty Xolo dog...! Guider of wandering spirits...!  And whose spirit have you guided to me?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I don't think he's a spirit guide.

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: Ah-ah-ah. The alebrijes of this world can take many forms... They are as mysterious as they are powerful...

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: You are the audience.  Darkness. And from the darkness... A giant PAPAYA!

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: Dancers emerge from the papaya and the dancers are all me!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I think it's just the right amount of obvious?  It could use some music... Oh! What if you did, like, doonk-doonk- doonk-doonk...

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: And... what if everything was on fire? Yes! Fire everywhere!

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: Inspired!  You... you have the spirit of an artist!

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: The dancers exit, the music fades, the lights go out! And Ernesto de la Cruz rises to the stage!

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: He does a couple of songs, the sun rises, everyone cheers--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Excuse me, where's the real de la Cruz?

Speaker: frida
Dialogue: Ernesto doesn't do rehearsals. He's too busy hosting that fancy party at the top of his tower.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Chamaco! You can't run off on me like that! C'mon, stop pestering the celebrities...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You said my great-great grandpa would be here! He's halfway across town, throwing some big party.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: That bum! Who doesn't show up to his own rehearsal?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: If you're such good friends, how come he didn't invite you?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: He's YOUR great-great grandpa.   How come he didn't invite YOU?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Hey Gustavo! You know anything about this party?

Speaker: gustavo
Dialogue: It's the hot ticket. But if you're not on the guest list you're never getting in, Chorizo...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Ha ha, very funny guys.      Very funny.

Speaker: gustavo
Dialogue: Oh, this guy's famous! Go on, go on, ask him how he died!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I don't want to talk about it.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I didn't choke, okay -- I got food poisoning, which is a big difference!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: This is why I don't like musicians... bunch of self- important jerks!

Speaker: gustavo
Dialogue: Well, if you really want to get to Ernesto, there IS that music competition at the Plaza de la Cruz. Winner gets to play at his party...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: No, no, no, chamaco, you are loco if you think--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I need to get my great-great grandfather's blessing.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Have you found him, Pepita?      Have you found our boy?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Why the heck would you wanna be a musician?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: My great-great grandpa was a musician.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: ...Who spent his life performing like a monkey for complete strangers. Blech, no, no thank you, gucala, no...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: So, how far is this guitar anyway?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: These people are all your family?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Eh, in a way... We're all the ones with no photos or ofrendas, no family to go home to. Nearly forgotten, you know?  So, we all call each other cousin, or to, or whatever.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Hey, hey! Save some for me!      Is Chicharrn around?

Speaker: ta chelo
Dialogue: In the bungalow. I don't know if he's in the mood for visitors...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Who doesn't like a visit from Cousin Hctor?

Speaker: chicharrn
Dialogue: I don't want to see your stupid face, Hctor.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: C'mon, it's Da de Muertos! I brought you a little offering!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I would, Cheech, but the thing is... me and my friend, Miguel, we really need to borrow your guitar.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I promise we'll bring it right back.

Speaker: chicharrn
Dialogue: Like the time you promised to bring back my van?

Speaker: chicharrn
Dialogue: Or my good napkins? My lasso?    My femur?!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: No, no, not like those times.

Speaker: chicharrn
Dialogue: I'm fading, Hctor. I can feel it.  You play me something.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You know I don't play anymore, Cheech. The guitar's for the kid--

Speaker: chicharrn
Dialogue: You want it, you got to earn it...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Only for you, amigo.     Any requests?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: WELL EVERYONE KNOWS JUANITA, HER EYES EACH A DIFFERENT COLOR. HER TEETH STICK OUT, AND HER CHIN GOES IN, AND HER...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: There are children present.  HER HAIR IS LIKE A BRIAR, SHE STANDS IN A BOW-LEGGED STANCE. AND IF I WEREN'T SO UGLY, SHE'D POSSIBLY GIVE ME A CHANCE!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: He's been forgotten.  When there's no one left in the living world who remembers you, you disappear from this world. We call it the "Final Death."

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But I've met him... I could remember him, when I go back...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: No, it doesn't work like that, chamaco. Our memories... they have to be passed down by those who knew us in life -- in the stories they tell about us. But there's no one left alive to pass down Cheech's stories...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You told me you hated musicians, you never said you were one.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: How do you think I knew your great- great grandpa? We used to play music together. Taught him everything he knows.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No manches! You played with Ernesto de la Cruz, the greatest musician of all time?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Ha-ha, you're funny! Greatest eyebrows of all time maybe but his music, eh, not so much.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You don't know what you're talking about...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Welcome to the Plaza de la Cruz!  Showtime, chamaco!

Speaker: emcee
Dialogue: Bienvenidos a todos!     Who's ready for some msica?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: So what's the plan?     What are you gonna play?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: C'mon, it's his most popular song!

Speaker: skeleton musician
Dialogue: REMEMBER ME, THOUGH I HAVE TO TRAVEL FAR, REMEMBER ME...

Speaker: opera singers
Dialogue: REMEMBER ME! DON'T LET IT MAKE YOU CRY!

Speaker: stagehand
Dialogue: De la Cruzcito? You're on standby!  Los Chachalacos, you're up next!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You always this nervous before a performance?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I don't know -- I've never performed before.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: What?! You said you were a musician!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I am!  I mean I will be.     Once I win.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: That's your plan?!  No, no, no, no, no, you have to win, Miguel. Your life LITERALLY depends on you winning! AND YOU'VE NEVER DONE THIS BEFORE?!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No!    I need to do this.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: If I can't go out there and play one song... how can I call myself a musician?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: 'Cuz I don't just want to get de la Cruz's blessing. I need to prove that... that I'm worthy of it.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Oh. Oh, that's such a sweet sentiment... at SUCH a bad time!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Okay... okay, okay, okay. Okay. Okay.  Okay you wanna perform? Then you've got to PERFORM!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Come on, yell! Belt it out! OOOOOOH HE-HE-HEY! Ha! Ah, feels good! Okay... now you.

Speaker: stagehand
Dialogue: De la Cruzcito, you're on now!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Make 'em listen, chamaco!        You got this!

Speaker: on stage
Dialogue: Miguel slowly takes the stage, guitar in hand.         He's blinded by the lights and squints out at the audience.         He's frozen stiff.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: What's he doing? Why isn't he playing?

Speaker: on stage
Dialogue: Panic is painted across Miguel's face.  AUDIENCE MEMBER  Bring back the singing dogs!  The crowd begins to murmur impatiently.         Miguel looks to Hctor in the wing.  Hctor makes eye contact with Miguel and does the "loosen up" bone shimmy.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: WHAT COLOR IS THE SKY? AY MI AMOR, AY MI AMOR YOU TELL ME THAT IT'S RED AY MI AMOR, AY MI AMOR WHERE SHOULD I PUT MY SHOES? AY MI AMOR, AY MI AMOR YOU SAY PUT THEM ON YOUR HEAD AY MI AMOR, AY MI AMOR

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Not bad for a dead guy!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You're not so bad yourself, gordito! Eso!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: THE LOCO THAT YOU MAKE ME IT IS JUST UN POCO CRAZY THE SENSE THAT YOU'RE NOT MAKING...

Speaker: ta rosita
Dialogue: Have you seen a living boy?

Speaker: on stage
Dialogue: HECTOR                               MIGUEL UN POQUI-TI-TI-TI-TI-TI-TI-TI-       UN POQUI-TI-TI-TI-TI-TI-TI-TI- TI-TI-TO LOCO!!                      TI-TI-TO LOCO!!  The audience erupts into applause!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Hey, you did good!     I'm proud of you! Eso!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: What, are you crazy?     We're about to win this thing!

Speaker: emcee
Dialogue: Damas y caballeros, I have an emergency announcement.  Please be on the lookout for a living boy, answers to the name of Miguel. Earlier tonight he ran away from his family. They just want to send him back to the Land of the Living...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Wait, wait, wait! You said de la Cruz was your ONLY family. The ONLY person who could send you home.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I do have other family, but--

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You could have taken my photo back this whole time?!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: --But they hate music!      I need a musician's blessing!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Look at me. I'm being forgotten, Miguel. I don't even know if I'm gonna last the night!  I'm not gonna miss my one chance to cross that bridge 'cause you want to live out some stupid musical fantasy!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I'm taking you to your family.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You don't wanna help me, you only care about yourself! Keep your dumb photo!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Hey, chamaco! Where did you go?! Chamaco! I'm sorry! Come back!

Speaker: crowd members
Dialogue: It's him! / It's that living boy! / I heard about him. / Look! / He's alive! / The boy's alive.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: This nonsense ends now, Miguel! I am giving you my blessing and you are going home!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Music's the only thing that makes me happy. And you, you wanna take that away!  You'll never understand.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Y AUNQUE LA VIDA ME CUESTE, LLORONA... NO DEJAR DE QUERERTE...

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Oh, I loved it.  I remember that feeling, when my husband would play, and I would sing and nothing else mattered. But when we had Coco, suddenly... there was something in my life that mattered more than music. I wanted to put down roots. He wanted to play for the world.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But I don't wanna... pick sides!  But you never will.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Oh!  El Santo!  I'm a big fan.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: It's okay. I'm Ernesto's great- great grandson!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You too! Hey, musician to musician, I need a favor...

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: Ooo, the competition winners! Congratulations chicos!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Pardon me, Seor de la Cruz!     Seor de la--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Seor de la Cruz!     Seor de la--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: SEORAS Y SEORES BUENAS TARDES, BUENAS NOCHES BUENAS TARDES, BUENAS NOCHES SEORITAS Y SEORES TO BE HERE WITH YOU TONIGHT BRINGS ME JOY! QU ALEGRA! FOR THIS MUSIC IS MY LANGUAGE AND THE WORLD ES MI FAMILIA

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: FOR THIS MUSIC IS MY LANGUAGE AND THE WORLD ES MI FAMILIA

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: FOR THIS MUSIC IS MY LANG--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I need your blessing. So I can go back home and be a musician, just like you.

MIGUEL  The rest of our family, they wouldn't listen. But I... I hoped you would?  DE LA CRUZ My boy, with a talent like yours, how could I not listen?  Miguel hugs de la Cruz who sweeps Miguel up onto his shoulders, showing him off to the room.  DE LA CRUZ I HAVE A GREAT-GREAT GRANDSON!  The crowd roars.  CUT TO:

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Yes, it is I. Frida Kahlo.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Dimple.   No dimple.      Dimple.   No dimple.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: It's just -- I've been looking up to you my whole life. You're the guy who actually did it! But...  Did you ever regret it? Choosing music over... everything else.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I can't... I have to get home before sunrise.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You said you'd take back my photo. You promised, Miguel.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I just met him tonight.      He told me he knew you--

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Please Miguel, put my photo up.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Those were MY songs you took.     MY songs that made YOU famous.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: If I'm being forgotten, it's because you never told anyone that I wrote them--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: That's crazy, de la Cruz wrote all his own songs.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You wanna tell him, or should I?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Look, I don't want to fight about it. I just want you to make it right. Miguel can put my photo up--

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: --And I can cross over the bridge. I can see my girl.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Ernesto... Remember the night I left?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: We drank together and you told me you would move heaven and earth for your amigo. Well, I'm asking you to now.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Heaven and earth?     Like in the movie?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: That's Don Hidalgo's toast... in the de la Cruz movie, "El Camino A Casa."

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I'm talking about my real life, Miguel.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: But in the movie, Don Hidalgo poisons the drink...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: That night, Ernesto.    The night I left...

Speaker: young hctor
Dialogue: This was your dream. You'll manage.

Speaker: young hctor
Dialogue: I'm going home, Ernesto.  Hate me if you want, but my mind is made up.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: All this time I thought it was just bad luck.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I never thought that you might have... that you...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You took everything away from me!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I just wanted to go back home!      No, no, NO!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You were going to give me your blessing...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: That you murdered Hctor... for his songs?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I -- no! Everyone knows you're the... the good guy.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Help! Can anyone hear me?        I wanna go home!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You were right. I should have gone back to my family--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: They told me not to be like de la Cruz, but I didn't listen--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I told them I didn't care if they remembered me. I didn't care if I was on their stupid ofrenda.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Hey, chamaco, it's okay.         It's okay.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I told them I didn't care.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: She's the reason you wanted to cross the bridge...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I just wanted to see her again...  My Coco...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Where... where did you get this?

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: That's my Mam Coco. That's my Mam Imelda. Is that... you?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I always hoped I'd see her again. That she'd miss me... maybe put up my photo. But it never happened.  But she's the last person who remembers me. The moment she's gone from the living world...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You disappear... from this one. You'll never get to see her...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: You know, I wrote her a song once. We used to sing it every night at the same time, no matter how far apart we were. What I wouldn't give to sing it to her... one last time.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: REMEMBER ME THOUGH I HAVE TO SAY GOODBYE REMEMBER ME DON'T LET IT MAKE YOU CRY FOR EVEN IF I'M FAR AWAY I HOLD YOU IN MY HEART I SING A SECRET SONG TO YOU EACH NIGHT WE ARE APART REMEMBER ME

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: THOUGH I HAVE TO TRAVEL FAR REMEMBER ME EACH TIME YOU HEAR A SAD GUITAR

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: He stole your guitar... He stole your songs...

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I didn't write "Remember Me" for the world... I wrote it for Coco. I'm a pretty sorry excuse for a great-great grandpa.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Are you kidding? A minute ago I thought I was related to a murderer. You're a total upgrade!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: My whole life, there's been something that made me different... and I never knew where it came from.  I'm proud we're family!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: TRRRRRRAAAAAI-HAAAI-HAAAAAY! I'm proud to be HIS family!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Dante, you knew he was my Pap Hctor the whole time! You ARE a real spirit guide!  Who's a good spirit guide? You are!

Speaker: family
Dialogue: Miguel! / Miguelito! / Ay, gracias a Dios! / It's Miguel! / He's all right! / Oh thank goodness! / Gracias, Dios mo!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Mijo, I was so worried! Thank goodness we found you in time!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: And you! How many times must I turn you away?

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I want nothing to do with you. Not in life, not in death!  I spent decades protecting my family from your mistakes. He spends five minutes with you and I have to fish him out of a sinkhole!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I wasn't in there `cause of Hctor. He was in there `cause of me.  He was just trying to get me home... I didn't wanna listen, but he was right... nothing is more important than family.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: So he can see Coco again.        Hctor should be on our ofrenda.        He's part of our family--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: He tried to go home to you and Coco... but de la Cruz murdered him!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: And so what if it's true? You leave me alone with a child to raise and I'm just supposed to forgive you?

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I'm running out of time.         It's Coco...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: You don't have to forgive him... But we shouldn't forget him.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I wanted to forget you. I wanted Coco to forget you too, but--

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: This is my fault, not yours.  I'm sorry, Imelda.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Miguel, if we help you get his photo... you will return home?          No more music?

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I -- I can't forgive you.        But I will help you.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: So how do we get to de la Cruz?

Speaker: on stage
Dialogue: Frida's performance piece begins. Dramatic symphonic music plays as a giant papaya appears to ignite on stage. The "seeds" in the body of the papaya unfurl to reveal that they are dancers, each dressed like Frida Kahlo, right down to the painted on unibrow.  The dancers roll out of the "flaming" papaya and gyrate their bodies nonsensically.  A giant cactus that resembles Frida is illuminated, and all the dancers slink to it.  In the midst of this, eight familiar looking dancers  inch their way out of the spotlights and to the wings of the stage.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Here, let me help you with--

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Now, we just have to find de la Cruz--

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: That's for murdering the love of my life!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: She's talking about me!  I'm the love of your life?

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I don't know! I'm still angry at you.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: And that's for trying to murder my grandson!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I don't know WHAT I said!

Speaker: stagehand
Dialogue: Places, seor, you're on in 30 seconds!

Speaker: on stage
Dialogue: ANNOUNCER  Ladies and gentlemen... the one, the only... ERNESTO DE LA CRUZ!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: AY DE M, LLORONA LLORONA DE AZUL CELESTE...

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: AY DE M, LLORONA LLORONA DE AZUL CELESTE...

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Y AUNQUE LA VIDA ME CUESTE, LLORONA, NO DEJAR DE QUERERTE. NO DEJAR DE QUERERTE!

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: ME SUB AL PINO MS ALTO, LLORONA, A VER SI TE DIVISABA.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: COMO EL PINO ERA TIERNO, LLORONA AL VERME LLORAR, LLORABA.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: I forgot what that felt like.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: Miguel, I give you my blessing.

Speaker: mam imelda
Dialogue: To never... forget how much your family loves you.

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: Ernesto, stop! Leave the boy alone!

Speaker: stadium
Dialogue: The image of de la Cruz holding Miguel hostage is projected on the stadium screens, the audience falls to a hush as they watch.  BACK TO:

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Hctor's the real musician, you're just the guy who murdered him and stole his songs!

Speaker: stadium
Dialogue: The audience gasps.     Some shrieks.  BACK TO:

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Hctor!   The photo, I lost it...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No!   We can still find the photo...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No, no, no, I can't leave you. I promised I'd put your photo up. I promised you'd see Coco!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: We're both out of time, mijo.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: No, no... she can't forget you!

Speaker: hctor
Dialogue: I just wanted her to know that I loved her.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: I promise I won't let Coco forget you! Aaahh!--

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Ah! I need to see Mam Coco, please--

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: What are you doing with that?     Give it to me!

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: Miguel!   Stop! Miguel!      Miguel! Miguel!   MIGUEL!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Mam Coco?     Can you hear me?   It's Miguel.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Here -- this was his guitar, right? He used to play it to you? See, there he is.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Mam Coco, please, don't forget him.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: What are you doing to that poor woman?

Speaker: pap
Dialogue: I thought I'd lost you, Migue...

Speaker: mam
Dialogue: We're all together now, that's what matters.

Speaker: abuelita
Dialogue: It's okay, mamita.  Miguel, you apologize to your Mam Coco!

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: Mam Coco? Your pap -- he wanted you to have this.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: REMEMBER ME THOUGH I HAVE TO SAY GOODBYE REMEMBER ME DON'T LET IT MAKE YOU CRY

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: FOR EVEN IF I'M FAR AWAY, I HOLD YOU IN MY HEART I SING A SECRET SONG TO YOU EACH NIGHT WE ARE APART

Speaker: mam coco
Dialogue: My pap used to sing me that song.

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: He loved you, Mam Coco.         Your pap loved you so much.

Speaker: mam coco
Dialogue: I kept... his letters... poems he wrote me... and...

Speaker: mam coco
Dialogue: Pap was a musician. When I was a little girl, he and Mam would sing such beautiful songs...

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: OUR LOVE FOR EACH OTHER WILL LIVE ON FOREVER IN EVERY BEAT OF MY PROUD CORAZN

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: AY MI FAMILIA! OIGA MI GENTE! CANTEN A CORO! LET IT BE KNOWN... OUR LOVE FOR EACH OTHER WILL LIVE ON FOREVER IN EVERY BEAT OF MY PROUD CORAZN

Speaker: miguel
Dialogue: AY MI FAMILIA! OIGA ME GENTE! CANTEN A CORO! LET IT BE KNOWN... OUR LOVE FOR EACH OTHER WILL LIVE ON FOREVER IN EVERY BEAT OF MY PROUD CORAZN
